alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:08AM CDT until August 04 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR OSAGE COUNTY... At 508 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding from heavy rainfall. Highway U near Linn was impassable due to flooding. Although the heaviest rainfall has ended, flash flooding may still be ongoing through the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Linn, Wardsville, Bland, Freeburg, Chamois, Westphalia, Rich Fountain, Meta, Argyle, Morrison, Loose Creek, Frankenstein, Bonnots Mill and Koeltztown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
